alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Pocahontas County through 1215 AM EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenbank, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cass Scenic Railroad, Greenbank, Dunmore and Arbovale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
